data.chText: 官方使命；正式组织
data.enText: official job/group

data.chText: 官方使命；使团的使命
data.enText: an important official job that a person or group of people is given to do, especially when they are sent to another country

data.chText: 赴华贸易使命
data.enText: a trade mission to China

data.chText: 核查事实的工作
data.enText: a fact-finding mission

data.chText: 帮助无家可归的难民的慈善工作
data.enText: a mercy mission to aid homeless refugees

data.chText: 使团；代表团；执行任务的地点
data.enText: a group of people doing such a job; the place where they work

data.chText: 在柏林的英国使团团长
data.enText: the head of the British mission in Berlin

data.chText: 传教
data.enText: teaching Christianity

data.chText: （尤指在海外的）传教，布道；布道团
data.enText: the work of teaching people about Christianity, especially in a foreign country; a group of people doing such work

data.chText: 在非洲的天主教传教士
data.enText: a Catholic mission in Africa

data.chText: 甘地对于布道和改变信仰的态度
data.enText: Gandhi's attitude to mission and conversion

data.chText: 布道所；传教区
data.enText: a building or group of buildings used by a Christian mission

data.chText: 职责
data.enText: your duty

data.chText: 使命；天职
data.enText: particular work that you feel it is your duty to do

data.chText: 她以帮助无家可归者为己任。
data.enText: Her mission in life was to work with the homeless.

data.chText: 军队
data.enText: of armed forces

data.chText: 军事行动
data.enText: an important job that is done by a soldier, group of soldiers, etc.

data.chText: 这支空军中队执行一项侦察任务。
data.enText: The squadron flew on a reconnaissance mission.

data.chText: 太空飞行
data.enText: space flight

data.chText: 太空飞行任务
data.enText: a flight into space

data.chText: 美国的太空飞行
data.enText: a US space mission

data.chText: 太空飞行的地面指挥人员
data.enText: mission control (= the people on earth who control and communicate with the people on the mission )

data.chText: 任务
data.enText: task

data.chText: （极其艰巨且需长时间才能完成的）任务，旅行
data.enText: a task or journey that is very difficult and takes a long time to complete

data.chText: 一路上要经历艰辛才能到达那里。
data.enText: It's a mission to get there.
mission accomplished

data.chText: 任务已完成；大功告成
data.enText: used when you have successfully completed what you have had to do

data.chText: 作艰苦的长途旅行（尤指去许多地方）
data.enText: to go on a long and difficult journey, especially one that involves going to many different places

data.chText: 我们跑遍了所有的酒吧才找到他。
data.enText: We had to mission round all the bars until we found him.

data.text: task ♦ duties ♦ mission ♦ job ♦ assignment ♦ chore

data.chText: 以上各词均指任务、工作。
data.enText: These are all words for a piece of work that sb has to do.
task

data.chText: 尤指艰巨或令人厌烦的任务、工作：
data.enText: a piece of work that sb has to do, especially a difficult or unpleasant one

data.chText: 我们的首项任务是架设通信系统。
data.enText: Our first task will be to set up a communications system.
duties

data.chText: 指职责、任务：
data.enText: tasks that are part of your job

data.chText: 你的职责将包括建立一个新的计算机系统。
data.enText: Your duties will include setting up a new computer system.
mission

data.chText: 指官方使命、使团的使命：
data.enText: an important official job that a person or group of people is given to do, especially when they are sent to another country

data.chText: 他们承担了在该地区核查事实的工作。
data.enText: They undertook a fact-finding mission in the region.
job

data.chText: 指一项任务、一件工作：
data.enText: a piece of work that sb has to do

data.chText: 我在家里有各种各样的活儿要干。
data.enText: I've got various jobs around the house to do.

data.chText: 用task还是job？
task可能比job艰巨，需要仔细思考如何去做；job可指许多要做的事情中的一件小事，尤指家务活；job有时指费时、沉闷或需要极大耐心的工作。
data.enText: A task may be more difficult than a job and require you to think carefully about how you are going to do it. A job may be sth small that is one of several jobs that you have to do, especially in the home; or a job can be sth that takes a long time and is boring and/or needs a lot of patience.
task or job?
assignment

data.chText: 指分派的工作、任务、布置的作业：
data.enText: a task that sb is given to do, usually as part of their job or studies

data.chText: 你必须完成三个书面作业。
data.enText: You must complete three written assignments.
chore

data.chText: 指日常事务、例行工作、尤指令人厌烦或无聊的家务活：
data.enText: a task that you have to do regularly, especially one that you do in the home and find unpleasant or boring

data.chText: 家务杂活
data.enText: household chores
the task/mission/job/chore of (doing) sth
(a) daily/day-to-day task/duties/job/chore
(a) routine task/duties/mission/job/assignment/chore
(a/an) easy/difficult/hard/challenging/impossible task/duties/mission/job/assignment
(a) household/domestic task/duties/job/chore
to do a task/your duties/a job/an assignment/the chores
to complete/finish a task/your duties/a mission/a job/an assignment/a chore
to give sb a task/their duties/a mission/a job/an assignment/a chore
to be on a(n) mission/job/assignment

simple_means.memory_skill: miss 送，放出 + ion 表名词 → 送出 → 派遣

means: 作艰苦的长途旅行(尤指去许多地方)

data.enText: mission accomplished

data.chText: 任务已完成；大功告成
data.enText: used when you have successfully completed what you have had to do

tr: the organized work of a religious missionary
a special assignment that is given to a person or group
example: his charge was deliver a message

tr: an operation that is assigned by a higher headquarters
example: the planes were on a bombing mission

tr: a group of representatives or delegates
an organization of missionaries in a foreign land sent to carry on religious work

value.def: A mission is an important task that people are given to do, especially one that involves travelling to another country.

example.ex: Salisbury sent him on a diplomatic mission to North America...
example.tran: 索尔兹伯里派他到北美执行一项外交任务。

example.ex: He has been on a mission to help end Lebanon's political crisis.
example.tran: 他已经被派执行一项旨在帮助结束黎巴嫩政治危机的使命。

example.ex: ...the most crucial stage of his latest peace mission.
example.tran: 他最近执行的和平使命中最关键的一个阶段

value.tran: (尤指赴他国的)使命，重要任务

value.def: A mission is a group of people who have been sent to a foreign country to carry out an official task.

example.ex: ...the head of the mission in South Africa.
...a senior member of a diplomatic mission.

value.def: A mission is a special journey made by a military aeroplane or space rocket.

example.ex: ...a bomber that crashed during a training mission in the west Texas mountains.
example.tran: 在得克萨斯州西部山区执行训练任务时坠毁的轰炸机

value.tran: （军用飞机或航天火箭的）飞行任务

value.def: If you say that you have a mission, you mean that you have a strong commitment and sense of duty to do or achieve something.

example.ex: He viewed his mission in life as protecting the weak from the evil...
example.tran: 他认为自己毕生的使命就是保护弱者不受邪恶势力的欺凌。

example.ex: There is an enormous sense of mission in his speech and gesture.
example.tran: 他的一言一行都带着强烈的使命感。

gramarinfo.label: usu poss N, also n <l>of</l> N

value.def: A mission is the activities of a group of Christians who have been sent to a place to teach people about Christianity.

example.ex: They say God spoke to them and told them to go on a mission to the poorest country in the Western Hemisphere.
example.tran: 他们说上帝让他们去西半球最贫困的国家传播教义。

value.def: A mission is a building or group of buildings in which missionary work is carried out.

example.ex: I reside at the mission at St Michael's.
example.tran: 我住在圣·米歇尔教堂的传道会里。
学校、修道院及其他布道场所

trans: (公司或组织的)宗旨说明，任务说明
航天任务；太空任务；飞越太空山；太空使命；空间任务

贸易代表团；贸易使团；美国商贸代表团

米申维耶霍；米慎维埃荷；市和加州米慎维荷；米慎维埃和

rootsaffixes.indicate: = to send, to cast 送, 放出
rootsaffixes.title: miss, mit

partsOfSpeech.dec: ad 加强 + mit 送，放出 → 送来 → 准许…进入
com 共同 + miss 送，放出 + ion 表名词 → 共同送出〔选出〕的人 → 委员会
com 共同 + mit 送，放出 → 共同派送 → 委任
dis 加强 + miss 送，放出 → 不断把人送出 → 解散
e 出 + miss 送，放出 + ary 表人 → 派出去的人 → 使者
e 出 + mit 送，放出 → 放出〔气味、光亮〕等 → 发光；发出〔气味等〕
e 出 + miss 送，放出 + ion 表名词 → 发出，放射
e 出 + miss 送，放出 + ive …的 → 发出的，放射的
inter 在…之间 + mit 送，放出 → 在发送之间〔间断〕→ 暂停，间断
intermit的形容词
miss 送，放出 + ion 表名词 → 送出 → 派遣
mission 派遣；使命 + ary 表人 →〔肩负传教〕使命 → 教士
per 自始至终 + mit 送，放出 → 始终〔允许〕发送 → 许可
permit的名词
permit的形容词
re 一再 + miss 送，放出 → 一再放走，错过的 → 粗心的
re 一再 + mit 送，放出 →〔把钱〕再送出去 → 汇款
sub 下 + mit 送，放出 → 放下 → 屈服
submit的名词
trans 横过 + mit 送，放出 → 跨距离传达、寄送 → 传达
trans 横过，越过 + miss 送，放出 + ion 表名词 → 跨距离转送、传达 → 转送；传达
